alert.note: Alert for Lower Bucks (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 15 at 5:48PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Mercer, northeastern Burlington, southwestern Monmouth and southeastern Bucks Counties through 615 PM EDT... At 548 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Burlington, or 10 miles south of Trenton, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Florence, Burlington, Bristol, Bordentown, Tullytown, Allentown, Wrightstown, Crosswicks, Florence-Roebling, Levittown, Browns Mills, Jobstown, Columbus, Jacksonville, Georgetown, White Horse, Hulmeville, Fieldsboro, Nws Office and Croydon. This includes the following highways... New Jersey Turnpike between exits 5 and 8. Pennsylvania Turnpike between mile markers 355 and 359. Interstate 95 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 39 and 40. Interstate 195 in New Jersey between mile markers 6 and 9. Interstate 295 in New Jersey between mile markers 45 and 60. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
